phbbgAcolyte0000.name: Acolyte
phbbgAcolyte0000.description:
Ability Scores: Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma

Feat: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.feats24.Item.phbftMagicInitia]{Magic Initiate} (Cleric)

Skill Proficiencies: Insight and Religion

Tool Proficiency: Calligrapher's Supplies

Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbtulCalligraph]{Calligrapher's Supplies}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBook0000000]{Book} (prayers), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHolySymbolV]{Holy Symbol}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagParchment00]{Parchment} (10 sheets), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRobe0000000]{Robe}, 8 GP; or (B) 50 GP

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixBackg.JournalEntryPage.phbbgAcolyte0000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

0.hint: Your background allows you to increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; increase one of them by 2 and a different one by 1, or increase all three by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.

1.hint: Your background grants you proficiency in Insight and Religion. It also grants you proficiency in Calligrapher's Supplies.

2.hint: Your background grants you the Magic Initiate (Cleric) feat.

3.hint: Your character knows at least three languages: Common plus two languages you roll or choose from the Standard Languages table.

phbbgCriminal000.name: Criminal
phbbgCriminal000.description:
Ability Scores: Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence

Feat: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.feats24.Item.phbftAlert000000]{Alert}

Skill Proficiencies: Sleight of Hand and Stealth

Tool Proficiency: Thieves' Tools

Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) 2 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepDagger0000]{Daggers}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbtulThievesToo]{Thieves' Tools}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagCrowbar0000]{Crowbar}, 2 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPouch000000]{Pouches}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.SsAmWV6YBqeOFihT]{Traveler's Clothes}, 16 GP; or (B) 50 GP

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixBackg.JournalEntryPage.phbbgCriminal000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

0.hint: Your background allows you to increase your Dexterity, Constitution, and Charisma scores; increase one of them by 2 and a different one by 1, or increase all three by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.

1.hint: Your backgrounds you the Alert feat.

2.hint: Your background grants you proficiency in Sleight of Hand and Stealth. It also grants you proficiency with Thieves' Tools.

3.hint: Your character knows at least three languages: Common plus two languages you roll or choose from the Standard Languages table.

phbbgSage0000000.name: Sage
phbbgSage0000000.description:
Ability Scores: Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom

Feat: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.feats24.Item.phbftMagicInitia]{Magic Initiate} (Wizard)

Skill Proficiencies: Arcana and History

Tool Proficiency: Calligrapher's Supplies

Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepQuartersta]{Quarterstaff}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbtulCalligraph]{Calligrapher's Supplies}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBook0000000]{Book} (history), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagParchment00]{Parchment} (8 sheets), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRobe0000000]{Robe}, 8 GP; or (B) 50 GP

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixBackg.JournalEntryPage.phbbgSage0000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

0.hint: Your background allows you to increase your Constitution, Intelligence, and Wisdom scores; increase one of them by 2 and a different one by 1, or increase all three by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.

1.hint: Your background grants you proficiency in Arcana and History. It also grants you proficiency with Calligrapher's Supplies.

2.hint: Your backgrounds grants you the Magic Initiate (Wizard) feat.

3.hint: Your character knows at least three languages: Common plus two languages you roll or choose from the Standard Languages table.

phbbgSoldier0000.name: Soldier
phbbgSoldier0000.description:
Ability Scores: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution

Feat: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.feats24.Item.phbftSavageAttac]{Savage Attacker}

Skill Proficiencies: Athletics and Intimidation

Tool Proficiency: Choose one kind of Gaming Set (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000.JournalEntryPage.GCvg8n7Q7ltSPRxe#gaming-set-(varies)]{chapter 6})

Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepSpear00000]{Spear}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepShortbow00]{Shortbow}, 20 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbamoArrows0000]{Arrows}, Gaming Set (same as above), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHealersKit0]{Healer's Kit}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagQuiver00000]{Quiver}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.SsAmWV6YBqeOFihT]{Traveler's Clothes}, 14 GP; or (B) 50 GP

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixBackg.JournalEntryPage.phbbgSoldier0000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

0.hint: Your background allows you to increase your Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores; increase one of them by 2 and a different one by 1, or increase all three by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.

1.hint: Your background grants you proficiency in Athletics and Intimidation. It also grants you proficiency with any Gaming Set.

2.hint: Your background grants you the Savage Attacker feat.

3.hint: Your character knows at least three languages: Common plus two languages you roll or choose from the Standard Languages table.

phbspAbyssalTief.name: Tiefling, Abyssal
phbspAbyssalTief.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspTiefling000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Abyssal

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspAbyssalTief inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Tiefling Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Medium (about 4–7 feet tall) or Small (about 3–4 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

Speed: 30 feet

As a Tiefling, you have the following special traits.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Fiendish Legacy. You are the recipient of a legacy that grants you supernatural abilities.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

Otherworldly Presence. You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy} cantrip. When you cast it with this trait, the spell uses the same spellcasting ability you use for your Fiendish Legacy trait.

Abyssal Legacy Traits
Level 1Level 3Level 5
You have Resistance to Poison damage. You also know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPoisonSpra]{Poison Spray} cantrip.@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofSickn]{Ray of Sickness}@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}

0.hint: Meidum (about 4-7 feet tall) or Small (about 3-4 feet tall)

2.hint: You have Resistance to Poison damage.

3.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait.

4.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait.

5.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspTiefling000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspChthonicTie inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

Otherworldly Presence. You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy} cantrip. When you cast it with this trait, the spell uses the same spellcasting ability you use for your Fiendish Legacy trait.

Fiendish Legacies

You have Resistance to Necrotic damage.You also know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplChillTouch]{Chill Touch} cantrip.@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFalseLife0]{False Life}@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee]{Ray of Enfeeblement}

4.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait.

5.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait.

6.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait.

phbspDragonborn0.name: Dragonborn
phbspDragonborn0.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspDragonborn0 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Dragonborn Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Medium (about 5–7 feet tall)

Speed: 30 feet

As a Dragonborn, you have these special traits.

Draconic Ancestry. Your lineage stems from a dragon progenitor. Choose the kind of dragon from the Draconic Ancestors table. Your choice affects your Breath Weapon and Damage Resistance traits as well as your appearance.

Draconic Ancestors
DragonDamage TypeDragonDamage Type
BlackAcidGoldFire
BlueLightningGreenPoison
BrassFireRedFire
BronzeLightningSilverCold
CopperAcidWhiteCold

Breath Weapon. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in either a 15-foot Cone or a 30-foot Line that is 5 feet wide (choose the shape each time). Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, a creature takes 1d10 damage of the type determined by your Draconic Ancestry trait. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach character levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to the damage type determined by your Draconic Ancestry trait.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Draconic Flight. When you reach character level 5, you can channel draconic magic to give yourself temporary flight. As a Bonus Action, you sprout spectral wings on your back that last for 10 minutes or until you retract the wings (no action required) or have the Incapacitated condition. During that time, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed. Your wings appear to be made of the same energy as your Breath Weapon. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

3.hint: You have Resistance to the damage type determined by your Draconic Ancestry trait.

phbspDrow0000000.name: Elf, Drow
phbspDrow0000000.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspElf00000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Drow

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspDrow0000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Elf Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Medium (about 5–6 feet tall)

Speed: 30 feet

As an Elf, you have these special traits.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Elven Lineage. You are part of a lineage that grants you supernatural abilities.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the lineage).

Drow Lineage Features
Level 1Level 3Level 5
The range of your Darkvision increases to 120 feet. You also know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights} cantrip.@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}

Fey Ancestry. You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the &Reference[Charmed] condition.

Keen Senses. You have proficiency in the Insight, Perception, or Survival skill.

Trance. You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a Long Rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

2.hint: You have proficiency in the Insight, Perception, or Survival skill.

3.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma can be chosen for your spellcasting ability.

4.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma can be chosen for your spellcasting ability.

5.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma can be chosen for your spellcasting ability.

phbspDwarf000000.name: Dwarf
phbspDwarf000000.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspDwarf000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Dwarf Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Medium (about 4–5 feet tall)

Speed: 30 feet

As a Dwarf, you have these special traits.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 120 feet.

Dwarven Resilience. You have Resistance to Poison damage. You also have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Poisoned condition.

Dwarven Toughness. Your Hit Point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level.

Stonecunning. As a Bonus Action, you gain Tremorsense with a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. You must be on a stone surface or touching a stone surface to use this Tremorsense. The stone can be natural or worked.You can use this Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

2.hint: You have Resistance to Poison damage.

phbspForestGnome.name: Gnome, Forest
phbspForestGnome.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspGnome000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Gnome Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Small (about 3–4 feet tall)

Speed: 30 feet

As a Gnome, you have these special traits.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Gnomish Cunning. You have Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

Gnomish Lineage. You are part of a lineage that grants you supernatural abilities. Whichever lineage you choose, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the lineage):

Forest Gnome. You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion} cantrip. You also always have the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpeakwithA]{Speak with Animals} spell prepared. You can cast it without a spell slot a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. You can also use any spell slots you have to cast the spell.

2.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma can be chosen for your spellcasting ability.

3.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma can be chosen for your spellcasting ability.

phbspGoliath0000.name: Goliath
phbspGoliath0000.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspGoliath0000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Goliath Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Medium (about 7–8 feet tall)

Speed: 35 feet

As a Goliath, you have these special traits.

Giant Ancestry. You are descended from Giants. Choose one of the following benefits—a supernatural boon from your ancestry; you can use the chosen benefit a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest:

Cloud's Jaunt (Cloud Giant). As a Bonus Action, you magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Fire's Burn (Fire Giant). When you hit a target with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can also deal 1d10 Fire damage to that target.

Frost's Chill (Frost Giant). When you hit a target with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can also deal 1d6 Cold damage to that target and reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

Hill's Tumble (Hill Giant). When you hit a Large or smaller creature with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can give that target the &Reference[Prone] condition.

Stone's Endurance (Stone Giant). When you take damage, you can take a Reaction to roll 1d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total.

Storm's Thunder (Storm Giant). When you take damage from a creature within 60 feet of you, you can take a Reaction to deal 1d8 Thunder damage to that creature.

Large Form. Starting at character level 5, you can change your size to Large as a Bonus Action if you're in a big enough space. This transformation lasts for 10 minutes or until you end it (no action required). For that duration, you have Advantage on Strength checks, and your Speed increases by 10 feet. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

Powerful Build. You have Advantage on any ability check you make to end the Grappled condition. You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

2.hint: You are descended from Giants. Choose one of the following benefits—a supernatural boon from your ancestry; you can use the chosen benefit a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

phbspHalfling000.name: Halfling
phbspHalfling000.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspHalfling000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Halfling Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Small (about 2–3 feet tall)

Speed: 30 feet

As a Halfling, you have these special traits.

Brave. You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Frightened condition.

Halfling Nimbleness. You can move through the space of any creature that is a size larger than you, but you can't stop in the same space.

Luck. When you roll a 1 on the d20 of a D20 Test, you can reroll the die, and you must use the new roll.

Naturally Stealthy. You can take the Hide action even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

phbspHighElf0000.name: Elf, High
phbspHighElf0000.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspElf00000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Keen Senses. You have proficiency in the Insight, Perception, or Survival skill.

Trance. You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a Long Rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

2.hint: You have proficiency in the Insight, Perception, or Survival skill.

3.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma can be chosen for your spellcasting ability.

phbspHuman000000.name: Human
phbspHuman000000.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspHuman000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Human Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Medium (about 4–7 feet tall) or Small (about 2–4 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

Speed: 30 feet

As a Human, you have these special traits.

Resourceful. You gain Heroic Inspiration whenever you finish a Long Rest.

Skillful. You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

Versatile. You gain an Origin feat of your choice (see chapter 5). Skilled is recommended.

0.hint: Medium (about 4-7 feet tall) or Small (about 2-4 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

2.hint: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

3.hint: You gain an Origin feat of your choice. Skillful is recommended.

phbspOrc00000000.name: Orc
phbspOrc00000000.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspOrc00000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Orc Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Medium (about 6–7 feet tall)

Speed: 30 feet

As an Orc, you have these special traits.

Adrenaline Rush. You can take the Dash action as a Bonus Action. When you do so, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Short or Long Rest.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 120 feet.

Relentless Endurance. When you are reduced to 0 Hit Points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 Hit Point instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

phbspRockGnome00.name: Gnome, Rock
phbspRockGnome00.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspGnome000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Gnome Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Small (about 3–4 feet tall)

Speed: 30 feet

As a Gnome, you have these special traits.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Gnomish Cunning. You have Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

Gnomish Lineage. You are part of a lineage that grants you supernatural abilities. Whichever lineage you choose, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the lineage):

Rock Gnome. You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMending000]{Mending} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation} cantrips. In addition, you can spend 10 minutes casting Prestidigitation to create a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 HP), such as a toy, fire starter, or music box. When you create the device, you determine its function by choosing one effect from Prestidigitation; the device produces that effect whenever you or another creature takes a Bonus Action to activate it with a touch. If the chosen effect has options within it, you choose one of those options for the device when you create it. For example, if you choose the spell's ignite-extinguish effect, you determine whether the device ignites or extinguishes fire; the device doesn't do both. You can have three such devices in existence at a time, and each falls apart 8 hours after its creation or when you dismantle it with a touch as a Utilize action.

2.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma can be chosen for your spellcasting ability.

phbspWoodElf0000.name: Elf, Wood
phbspWoodElf0000.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspElf00000000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Wood Elves

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixSpeci.JournalEntryPage.phbspWoodElf0000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Elf Traits

Creature Type: Humanoid

Size: Medium (about 5–6 feet tall)

Speed: 30 feet

As an Elf, you have these special traits.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Elven Lineage. You are part of a lineage that grants you supernatural abilities.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the lineage).

Wood Elf Lineage Features
Level 1Level 3Level 5
Your Speed increases to 35 feet. You also know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft} cantrip.@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLongstride]{Longstrider}@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPasswithou]{Pass without Trace}

Fey Ancestry. You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Charmed condition.

Keen Senses. You have proficiency in the Insight, Perception, or Survival skill.

Trance. You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a Long Rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

3.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma can be chosen for your spellcasting ability.

4.hint: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma can be chosen for your spellcasting ability.

5.hint: You have proficiency in the Insight, Perception, or Survival skill.

phbsptAbyssalLeg.name: Fiendish Legacy, Abyssal
phbsptAbyssalLeg.description:
You are the recipient of a legacy that grants you supernatural abilities.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

Abyssal

The entropy of the Abyss, the chaos of Pandemonium, and the despair of Carceri call to tieflings who have the abyssal legacy. Horns, fur, tusks, and peculiar scents are common physical features of such tieflings, most of whom have the blood of demons coursing through their veins.

Abyssal Legacy Traits
Level 1Level 3Level 5
You have Resistance to Poison damage. You also know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPoisonSpra]{Poison Spray} cantrip.@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofSickn]{Ray of Sickness}@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}

Foundry Note

The Resistance and spells are granted to you automatically and you will be prompted to choose the spellcasting ability during advancement.

phbsptAdrenaline.name: Adrenaline Rush
phbsptAdrenaline.description: You can take the Dash action as a Bonus Action. When you do so, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Short or Long Rest.

phbsptBrave00000.name: Brave
phbsptBrave00000.description: You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the &Reference[Frightened] condition.

phbsptBreathWeap.name: Breath Weapon
phbsptBreathWeap.description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in either a 15-foot Cone or a 30-foot Line that is 5 feet wide (choose the shape each time). Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, a creature takes 1d10 damage of the type determined by your Draconic Ancestry trait. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach character levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

The Breath Weapon (Cone) and Breath Weapon (Line) activities are both configured for their template type and include each type of damage. The damage also scales as you level up.

You can select the damage type in the damage roll's dialog box. It will remember your damage choice afterwards. You can edit the activities to remove the other damage types to skip this.

phbsptChthonicLe.name: Fiendish Legacy, Chthonic
phbsptChthonicLe.description:
You are the recipient of a legacy that grants you supernatural abilities.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

Chthonic

Tieflings who have the chthonic legacy feel not only the tug of Carceri but also the greed of Gehenna and the gloom of Hades. Some of these tieflings look cadaverous. Others possess the unearthly beauty of a succubus, or they have physical features in common with a night hag, a yugoloth, or some other Neutral Evil fiendish ancestor.

Chthonic Legacy Traits
Level 1Level 3Level 5
You have Resistance to Necrotic damage.You also know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplChillTouch]{Chill Touch} cantrip.@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFalseLife0]{False Life}@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee]{Ray of Enfeeblement}

Foundry Note

The Resistance and spells are granted to you automatically and you will be prompted to choose the spellcasting ability during advancement.

phbsptCloudsJaun.name: Cloud's Jaunt
phbsptCloudsJaun.description: As a Bonus Action, you magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

phbsptDraconicFl.name: Draconic Flight
phbsptDraconicFl.description:
When you reach character level 5, you can channel draconic magic to give yourself temporary flight. As a Bonus Action, you sprout spectral wings on your back that last for 10 minutes or until you retract the wings (no action required) or have the Incapacitated condition. During that time, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed. Your wings appear to be made of the same energy as your Breath Weapon. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect for tracking but it does not automatically grant the Fly Speed.

phbsptDrowElfLin.name: Elven Lineage, Drow
phbsptDrowElfLin.description:
You are part of a lineage that grants you supernatural abilities.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the lineage).

Drow Lineage Features

Level 1

Level 3

Level 5

The range of your Darkvision increases to 120 feet. You also know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights} cantrip.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}

Foundry Note

You will automatically be granted the relevant features and spells when you select the species and as you level up.

phbsptDwarvenRes.name: Dwarven Resilience
phbsptDwarvenRes.description:
You have Resistance to Poison damage. You also have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Poisoned condition.

Foundry Note

You will automatically be granted Resistance to Poison damage but not Advantage on saving throws to avoid/end the Poisoned condition.

phbsptDwarvenTou.name: Dwarven Toughness
phbsptDwarvenTou.description:
Your Hit Point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level.

Foundry Note

The Hit Point maximum increase is handled automatically each level.

phbsptFeyAncestr.name: Fey Ancestry
phbsptFeyAncestr.description: You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the &Reference[Charmed] condition.

phbsptFiresBurn0.name: Fire's Burn
phbsptFiresBurn0.description: When you hit a target with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can also deal 1d10 Fire damage to that target.

phbsptForestGnom.name: Gnomish Lineage, Forest
phbsptForestGnom.description:
You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion} cantrip. You also always have the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpeakwithA]{Speak with Animals} spell prepared. You can cast it without a spell slot a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. You can also use any spell slots you have to cast the spell.

Foundry Note

The free castings are included in the spell.

phbsptFrostsChil.name: Frost's Chill
phbsptFrostsChil.description:
When you hit a target with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can also deal 1d6 Cold damage to that target and reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect which can be used for tracking and reduces their Speed by 10.

phbsptGiantAnces.name: Giant Ancestry
phbsptGiantAnces.description:
You are descended from Giants. Choose one of the following benefits—a supernatural boon from your ancestry; you can use the chosen benefit a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest:

Cloud's Jaunt (Cloud Giant). As a Bonus Action, you magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Fire's Burn (Fire Giant). When you hit a target with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can also deal 1d10 Fire damage to that target.

Frost's Chill (Frost Giant). When you hit a target with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can also deal 1d6 Cold damage to that target and reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

Hill's Tumble (Hill Giant). When you hit a Large or smaller creature with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can give that target the Prone condition.

Stone's Endurance (Stone Giant). When you take damage, you can take a Reaction to roll 1d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total.

Storm's Thunder (Storm Giant). When you take damage from a creature within 60 feet of you, you can take a Reaction to deal 1d8 Thunder damage to that creature.

phbsptGnomishCun.name: Gnomish Cunning
phbsptGnomishCun.description: You have Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

phbsptHalflingNi.name: Halfling Nimbleness
phbsptHalflingNi.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is a size larger than you, but you can't stop in the same space.

phbsptHighElfLin.name: Elven Lineage, High Elf
phbsptHighElfLin.description:
You are part of a lineage that grants you supernatural abilities.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the lineage).

High Elf Lineage Features
Level 1Level 3Level 5
You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation} cantrip. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can replace that cantrip with a different cantrip from the Wizard spell list.@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}

Foundry Note

You will automatically be granted the relevant features and spells when you select the species and as you level up.

phbsptHillsTumbl.name: Hill's Tumble
phbsptHillsTumbl.description: When you hit a Large or smaller creature with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can give that target the &Reference[Prone] condition.

phbsptInfernalLe.name: Fiendish Legacy, Infernal
phbsptInfernalLe.description:
You are the recipient of a legacy that grants you supernatural abilities.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

Infernal

The infernal legacy connects tieflings not only to Gehenna but also the Nine Hells and the raging battlefields of Acheron. Horns, spines, tails, golden eyes, and a faint odor of sulfur or smoke are common physical features of such tieflings, most of whom trace their ancestry to devils.

Infernal Legacy Traits
Level 1Level 3Level 5
You have Resistance to Fire damage. You also know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireBolt00]{Fire Bolt} cantrip.@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHellishReb]{Hellish Rebuke}@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}

Foundry Note

The Resistance and spells are granted to you automatically and you will be prompted to choose the spellcasting ability during advancement.

phbsptKeenSenses.name: Keen Senses
phbsptKeenSenses.description:
You have proficiency in the Insight, Perception, or Survival skill.

Foundry Note

You will be prompted for your choice after selecting this species.

phbsptLargeForm0.name: Large Form
phbsptLargeForm0.description:
Starting at character level 5, you can change your size to Large as a Bonus Action if you're in a big enough space. This transformation lasts for 10 minutes or until you end it (no action required). For that duration, you have Advantage on Strength checks, and your Speed increases by 10 feet. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect which automatically increases your walking Speed but does not automate the Advantage.

phbsptLuck000000.name: Luck
phbsptLuck000000.description: When you roll a 1 on the d20 of a D20 Test, you can reroll the die, and you must use the new roll.

phbsptNaturallyS.name: Naturally Stealthy
phbsptNaturallyS.description: You can take the &Reference[Hide] action even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

phbsptOtherworld.name: Otherworldly Presence
phbsptOtherworld.description:
You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy} cantrip. When you cast it with this trait, the spell uses the same spellcasting ability you use for your Fiendish legacy trait.

Foundry Note

When you're granted this spell it will allow you to choose your spellcasting ability.

phbsptPowerfulBu.name: Powerful Build
phbsptPowerfulBu.description:
You have Advantage on any ability check you make to end the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition. You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect which automatically upgrades your size when determining carrying capacity.

phbsptRelentless.name: Relentless Endurance
phbsptRelentless.description: When you are reduced to 0 Hit Points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 Hit Point instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

phbsptResourcefu.name: Resourceful
phbsptResourcefu.description: You gain Heroic Inspiration whenever you finish a Long Rest.

phbsptRockGnomeL.name: Gnomish Lineage, Rock
phbsptRockGnomeL.description: You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMending000]{Mending} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation} cantrips. In addition, you can spend 10 minutes casting Prestidigitation to create a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 HP), such as a toy, fire starter, or music box. When you create the device, you determine its function by choosing one effect from Prestidigitation; the device produces that effect whenever you or another creature takes a Bonus Action to activate it with a touch. If the chosen effect has options within it, you choose one of those options for the device when you create it. For example, if you choose the spell's ignite-extinguish effect, you determine whether the device ignites or extinguishes fire; the device doesn't do both. You can have three such devices in existence at a time, and each falls apart 8 hours after its creation or when you dismantle it with a touch as a Utilize action.

phbsptSkillful00.name: Skillful
phbsptSkillful00.description:
You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

Foundry Note

You will be prompted for this choice when you select this Species.

phbsptStonecunni.name: Stonecunning
phbsptStonecunni.description:
As a Bonus Action, you gain &Reference[Tremorsense] with a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. You must be on a stone surface or touching a stone surface to use this Tremorsense. The stone can be natural or worked. You can use this Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

This feature includes the limited uses and an Active Effect that grants you the 60 feet of Tremorsense. It does not automatically update your Token's vision settings.

phbsptStonesEndu.name: Stone's Endurance
phbsptStonesEndu.description: When you take damage, you can take a Reaction to roll 1d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total.

phbsptStormsThun.name: Storm's Thunder
phbsptStormsThun.description: When you take damage from a creature within 60 feet of you, you can take a Reaction to deal 1d8 Thunder damage to that creature.

phbsptTrance0000.name: Trance
phbsptTrance0000.description: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a Long Rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

phbsptVersatile0.name: Versatile
phbsptVersatile0.description:
You gain an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbFeats00000000.JournalEntryPage.otAeQs0TLHYIBNuj]{Origin feat} of your choice. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.feats24.Item.phbftSkilled0000]{Skilled} is recommended.

Foundry Note

You will be prompted for your choice when you select this Species.

phbsptWoodElfLin.name: Elven Lineage, Wood Elf
phbsptWoodElfLin.description:
You are part of a lineage that grants you supernatural abilities.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the lineage).

Wood Elf Lineage Features
Level 1Level 3Level 5
Your Speed increases to 35 feet. You also know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft} cantrip.@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLongstride]{Longstrider}@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPasswithou]{Pass without Trace}

Foundry Note

You will automatically be granted the relevant features and spells when you select the species and as you level up.
